text: Marie Bochet (born February 9, 1994 in Chambéry) is a skier from France. She was 5 when she started skiing. She has a disability. She was the first skier to finish in the Giant Slalom race. She skied at the 2011 IPC Alpine Skiing World Championships. She was the second skier to finish in the standing women's downhill race and the Super G. Bocket skiied in the 2014 Winter Paralympics in Sochi, Russia, where she won four gold medals. ==References== Category:French skiers Category:Living people Category:1994 births Category:Competitors at the 2018 Winter Paralympics Category:French sportspeople with disabilities Category:People from Chambéry Category:Sportspeople from Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes
title: Marie Bochet
